tweets.text:
@EnvAgencyMids Have a look at some real data, recorded by residents on calibrated detection machines  
http://86.27.7.64:1001/Newcastle/?fbclid=IwAR0sx7nRP79Y8La_05lFvo3pgDGhD1NqEpOmYn251V9d8gsZLROD2lltxIw

Read our latest update for #WalleysQuarry landfill site here üëâhttps://t.co/o558iAVicn

We're visiting the surrounding area on an almost daily basis to carry out odour amenity checks. We're also continuing to inspect the site, including monitoring the progress of the capping. https://t.co/FsLQlvsU0f
@EnvAgencyMids Only when we no longer breathe toxic, poisonous, life destroying gasses rather than air, only then will this mean ANYTHING #STOPTHESTINK
A scrapyard in Croydon operating without an impermeable surface. Will flag to @EnvAgencySE. https://t.co/7yfJlyHacK

When you don't want to shop, eat or drink in your local area because of the gas and smell from #WalleysQuarry, but you want to support your local businesses #dilemma #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe @NewsNBC @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA

I wake up wondering what "wonderful" odour will greet me from Walley's Quarry. It is ruining people's lives and health. RED need to start answering questions and speaking to the people of Newcastle  @AaronBell4NUL @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @BorisJohnson @StaffordshireCC

tweets.text: Good lord - what a waste of breath. I don‚Äôt want to hear you‚Äôre very concerned @EnvAgency - I want to hear you‚Äôre shutting @RedIndustries2 monstrosity of a landfill & cleaning it up! @ClareDinnisEA @PHE_EoEngland @MattHancock @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off #stopthestink #capitoff https://t.co/CmC2ChNKPH

tweets.text: Can anyone who reads this sign this petition.If a landfill can be extended by the govt by overriding council decisions then offensive waste snuck on the permit in a town of 139,000 people it can happen to you-WE CANT BREATHE @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland @StinkStopthe https://t.co/hbjrjdje8c

That‚Äôs @redindustries2, a waste ‚Äúmanagement‚Äù company in a league of their own.  They account for 80% of all odour complaints to the Environment Agency !  And as this table shows their 24hr average measured hydrogen sulphide emission is 27 times greater than the runner up !! https://t.co/Hq0uyNLEv0

It‚Äôs not good enough to be kept waiting for the @EnvAgency air monitoring results & the leaking pipe results. And it‚Äôs not good enough that politics and money are influencing decisions made by organisations who should be beyond reproach. Help us before it‚Äôs too late @StinkStopthe https://t.co/5TUbegiisy

Let‚Äôs talk hydrogen sulphide. 

An average landfill at maximum emits around an average of 3-5ugm3 at its peak.  

Walleys quarry emitted 202ugm3.  A mere 40 times higher.  

 @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK @BorisJohnson @CHEMTrust @MattHancock 
#StopTheStink https://t.co/7wFYZmphcm

I honestly cannot remember the last time I wasn‚Äôt woke up by the #walleysquarry gases or waking up to find it all in the house. This is getting SO out of hand it is scary. We can‚Äôt live like this. It is torture. #stopthestink @AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_WestMids https://t.co/mMwXKzP3FY

Those houses seem very close to a landfill don‚Äôt they. Especially one that‚Äôs as badly managed as Walleys Quarry.

@EnvAgencyMids @UKParliament

tweets.text: @Sotlive Yes I've received a letter today from the environmental agency saying they have set up 2 monitoring posts that leaves 6 wind directions not monitored 5 breaches have been made by red industries they are still allowed to run the site it needs stopping now and capping no more waste

@SaveLeaMarshes @HMUG_Hackney @RomanGeezer @StonebridgeLock @EnvAgencySE @LDNWaterkeeper @theriverstrust @DrCSyn @tfortysix Photo scoop! Thames Water team arrived while I was at Shortlands sewer this afternoon. They'd traced the culprit in the adjacent industrial estate & served a notice. The green dye is their tracer. They began the cleanup (worker photo with permission). https://t.co/mvMsIjnQqF

The Environment Agency says it is 'very concerned' about the increase in complaints.
